young people today, lack the time for inner reflection on their emotions.
Our own community, compared to the past ones, has shown more consideration regarding this issue, but today we speak of
emotional ignorance, as defined by Prof. [redacted_name], philosopher and psychoanalyst, or emotional
illiteracy, as defined by [redacted_name], an American psychologist, that inability to recognise and manage
one's own and others' emotions.
